org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch

Class LineSearchConditions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch.LineSearchConditions

  • public class LineSearchConditions
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of static methods that check whether a selected step size value satisfies certain conditions for the given optimization problem.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

    • Method Detail

      • checkArmijoCondition

        public static boolean checkArmijoCondition(AbstractFunction objective,
                                           Vector point,
                                           Vector direction,
                                           double stepSize,
                                           double c,
                                           double objectiveValueAtCurrentPoint,
                                           Vector objectiveGradientAtCurrentPoint)
        Checks whether the Armijo condition (also known as the sufficient decrease condition) is satisfied for a given objective function, point, direction and step size. The Armijo condition makes sure that the reduction in the objective function value is proportional to both the step size and the directional derivative. A typical value for the proportionality constant, c, is 1e-4.
        Parameters:
        objective - The objective function instance.
        point - The point at which we check whether the Armijo condition is satisfied.
        direction - The direction for which we check whether the Armijo condition is satisfied.
        stepSize - The value of the step size for which we check whether the Armijo condition is satisfied.
        c - The proportionality constant used for the Armijo condition. The value provided must lie between 0 and 1.
        objectiveValueAtCurrentPoint - The value of the objective function at the current point.
        objectiveGradientAtCurrentPoint - The gradient of the objective function evaluated at the current point.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating whether the Armijo condition is satisfied for the given objective, point, direction and step size.

      • checkWolfeConditions

        public static boolean checkWolfeConditions(AbstractFunction objective,
                                           Vector point,
                                           Vector direction,
                                           double stepSize,
                                           double c1,
                                           double c2,
                                           boolean strong,
                                           double objectiveValueAtCurrentPoint,
                                           Vector objectiveGradientAtCurrentPoint)
        Checks whether the Wolfe conditions are satisfied for a given objective function, point, direction and step size. The Wolfe conditions consist of the Armijo condition (also known as the sufficient decrease condition) and the curvature condition. The Armijo condition makes sure that the reduction in the objective function value is proportional to both the step size and the directional derivative. This condition is satisfied for all sufficiently small values of the step size and so, in order to ensure that the optimization algorithm makes sufficient progress, we also check for the curvature condition. Typical values for the proportionality constants are: for c1, 1e-4, and for c2, 0.9 when the search direction is chosen by a Newton or quasi-Newton method and 0.1 when the search direction is obtained from a nonlinear conjugate gradient method.
        Parameters:
        objective - The objective function instance.
        point - The point at which we check whether the Wolfe conditions are satisfied.
        direction - The direction for which we check whether the Wolfe conditions are satisfied.
        stepSize - The value of the step size for which we check whether the Wolfe conditions are satisfied.
        c1 - The proportionality constant used for the first of the two Wolfe conditions (that is, the Armijo condition). The value provided must lie between 0 and 1.
        c2 - The proportionality constant used for the second of the two Wolfe conditions (that is, the curvature condition). The value provided must lie between c1 and 1.
        strong - A boolean value indicating whether or not to check for the strong Wolfe conditions. The only difference is actually on the curvature condition and, when we use the strong Wolfe conditions instead of the simple Wolfe conditions, we effectively exclude points from the search that are far from the exact line search solution.
        objectiveValueAtCurrentPoint - The value of the objective function at the current point.
        objectiveGradientAtCurrentPoint - The gradient of the objective function evaluated at the current point.
        Returns:
        A boolean value ind objective, point, direction and step size.

      • checkGoldsteinConditions

        public static boolean checkGoldsteinConditions(AbstractFunction objective,
                                               Vector point,
                                               Vector direction,
                                               double stepSize,
                                               double c,
                                               double objectiveValueAtCurrentPoint,
                                               Vector objectiveGradientAtCurrentPoint)
        Checks whether the Goldstein conditions are satisfied for a given objective function, point, direction and step size. The Goldstein conditions are similar to the Wolfe conditions and they can also be stated as a pair of inequalities: one inequality corresponding to the Armijo condition (also known as the sufficient decrease condition) and another inequality used to bound the step size from below. However, that second inequality in the case of the Goldstein conditions might exclude all points from the search that are solutions to the exact line search problem. The Goldstein conditions are often used in Newton-type methods but are not well suited for quasi-Newton methods that maintain a positive definite Hessian approximation.
        Parameters:
        objective - The objective function instance.
        point - The point at which we check whether the Goldstein conditions are satisfied.
        direction - The direction for which we check whether the Goldstein conditions are satisfied.
        stepSize - The value of the step size for which we check whether the Goldstein conditions are satisfied.
        c - The proportionality constant used for the Goldstein conditions. The value provided must lie between 0 and 0.5.
        objectiveValueAtCurrentPoint - The value of the objective function at the current point.
        objectiveGradientAtCurrentPoint - The gradient of the objective function evaluated at the current point.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating whether the Goldstein conditions are satisfied for the given objective, point, direction and step size.
